issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
We are no longer validating the date in regular (not presigned) non v4 signed requests. The date could be from a "Date" header or an "X-Amz-Date" header.

Example with "X-Amz-Date" header in the past (expired):

{code}
GET /object-1 HTTP/1.1
Host: 3fdf7aacdc58cc54.s3.d-37.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773
Authorization: AWS AKIAARNAQMYPJ6F7PKQK:FyUovpTLO3whPIj4DaJ0cvaI5uo=
X-Amz-Date: Wed, 31 Dec 1969 16:32:30 PST
User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.11.68 Linux/4.9.5-200.fc25.x86_64 Java_HotSpot(TM)_64-Bit_Server_VM/25.92-b14/1.8.0_92

x-amz-request-id: 46b9b7cf-6e60-4591-a755-4dcad26715f7
{code}

Checking the date is important to prevent replays.

{quote}
A valid time stamp (using either the HTTP Date header or an x-amz-date alternative) is mandatory for authenticated requests. Furthermore, the client timestamp included with an authenticated request must be within 15 minutes of the Amazon S3 system time when the request is received. If not, the request will fail with the RequestTimeTooSkewed error code. The intention of these restrictions is to limit the possibility that intercepted requests could be replayed by an adversary. 
{quote}

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/RESTAuthentication.html
fields.summary: S3 should validate date for signed requests

comments.body: [~sjones] What approach are you using to tweak the Date header? GetObjectRequest.putCustomRequestHeader via the SDK seems to have no effect since the current Date headers are injected afterwords.
See EUCA-13204 branch on internal server. Commit: db6bd3d
[~jhalterman], this bug is for validating the date in signature v2 requests (see examples in description)
[~jhalterman], the fix does not do validation of the X-Amz-Date header (should be the only date validated when used)

[~sjones] S3Authentication.getDateFromHeaders prioritizes the X-Amz-Date over the Date header, the result of which is parsed and validated. I am able to verify this behavior by overriding X-Amz-Date when making a V2 request.
[~jhalterman], ah right. The fix looks good to me.

Verified. Now it throws {{RequestTimeTooSkewed}} error if an request is expired or future dated, {code} RequestTimeTooSkewed The difference between the request time and the server's time is too large. 72be6da1-d2ce-428a-87d7-9b41e227613a {code} {code} 395 [main] DEBUG com.amazonaws.request -
